item.title: ‘A victory for common sense’: Government confirms Budget decision to hike taxes on online gambling
item.description: The Government has confirmed its agreement with the Treasury Committee’s view that online gaming should be subject to increased taxation while other forms such as horse racing and bingo should not.

item.title: Current approach to AI in financial services risks serious harm to consumers and wider system
item.description: The Bank of England, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and the Treasury are exposing the public and the financial system to potentially serious harm due to their current positions on the use of artificial intelligence in financial services, according to a new report by the Treasury Select Committee.

item.title: National Wealth Fund Strategy to reflect Committee recommendations
item.description: The Government has confirmed that the National Wealth Fund Strategy will contain each of the four key requirements set out by the Treasury Committee

item.title: Government responds to Cash ISA report
item.description: The Government’s response to the Treasury Committee report on the Cash ISA has been published

item.title: 15 years of the OBR: MPs to look at role and potential reforms in new inquiry
item.description: The Treasury Committee is launching a new inquiry reflecting on the Office for Budget Responsibility’s (OBR) first 15 years.

item.title: Statement on the resignation of Richard Hughes
item.description: The Chair of the Treasury Select Committee, Dame Meg Hillier, has issued a statement following the resignation of Richard Hughes as Chair of the Office for Budget Responsibility (OBR).

item.title: Financial inclusion ‘must not be box-ticking exercise’: new inquiry launches
item.description: Today, the Treasury Committee is launching a new inquiry into the Government’s Financial Inclusion Strategy.

item.title: OBR responds to Chair letter ahead of Tuesday morning public session
item.description: The Committee has published two letters from the Chair of the Office for Budget Responsibility (OBR), Richard Hughes.

item.title: Lifetime ISA reform welcomed by Chair
item.description: Dame Meg Hillier, Chair of the Treasury Select Committee, has issued a statement following confirmation in the Budget of a new product to replace the Lifetime ISA.

item.title: ‘Scaremongering has failed’: Meg Hillier statement on gambling tax changes announced in Budget
item.description: Chair of the Treasury Committee, Dame Meg Hillier, has issued a statement following the announcement by the Treasury that they are raising taxes on online gambling while protecting face-to-face gambling.

item.title: Chancellor, OBR and economists Budget sessions announced
item.description: The Treasury Select Committee today announces a series of evidence sessions which will scrutinise the 2025 Budget.

item.title: ‘Cavalier’ approach to Child Benefit checks criticised by Treasury Committee Chair
item.description: A new letter published by the Treasury Committee confirms HMRC removed employment checks when expanding the use of flight data to detect Child Benefit fraud, after which 23,794 claimants had their payments suspended.

item.title: Do not cave in to industry scaremongering – taxes on online betting games must reflect the harms they cause say MPs
item.description: The Government must be bold in the face of industry scaremongering and tax online betting games at a rate which reflects the growth of harmful and addictive betting practices, says a report published today by the Treasury Committee.

item.title: In embracing risk to stimulate new markets, be prepared for some National Wealth Fund investments to fail, say MPs
item.description: The National Wealth Fund (NWF) must have the appetite to take risks or it is unlikely to fulfil its purpose of crowding investment into sectors which would not easily attract private funding, according to a report published by the Treasury Committee today (Tuesday 28 October).

item.title: Government should not cut the Cash ISA allowance
item.description: Cutting the Cash ISA allowance is unlikely to incentivise people to invest their cash in stocks and shares, a new report by the Treasury Select Committee warns.

item.title: Amazon outage prompts letter to Economic Secretary
item.description: Following the outage affecting Amazon Web Services, the Treasury Committee has sent a letter to the Economic Secretary to the Treasury.

item.title: Government fails to action Committee’s recommendations on reform of Lifetime ISA
item.description: The Government has not heeded warnings from the Treasury Committee that the Lifetime ISA (LISA) requires reform

item.title: Financial Ombudsman Service: departure of CEO and ‘disrespectful’ actions of Chair
item.description: A new report sets out the Treasury Select Committee’s assessment of the handling of the departure of previous Chief Executive Officer, Abby Thomas, from the Financial Ombudsman Service

item.title: Bank of England commits to monitoring cash acceptance on ongoing basis
item.description: The Government has confirmed that the Bank of England will monitor cash acceptance on an ongoing basis following a Treasury Select Committee report published earlier this year

item.title: ‘Complex’ Lifetime ISA increases risk of poor financial decisions
item.description: The Lifetime ISA’s (LISA) dual-purpose design may be diverting people away from more suitable products and putting part of their savings at risk, according to a new report
